canonical_explanation.text: A chemical reaction is a process in which one or more substances (reactants) are converted into one or more new substances (products) with different properties. Chemical reactions can be represented using word equations, where the names of reactants are written on the left side and products on the right side, separated by an arrow. Combination reactions involve two or more substances combining to form a single product (A + B gives AB). Decomposition reactions involve a single substance breaking down into two or more simpler substances (AB gives A + B). Reactions that release heat are called exothermic reactions (like burning), while reactions that absorb heat are called endothermic reactions (like photosynthesis).
rules: Chemical reaction: process where new substances are formed
Reactants: starting materials in a reaction
Products: substances formed in a reaction
Word equation: reactants on left, products on right
Combination reaction: A + B gives AB
Decomposition reaction: AB gives A + B

questions.question_text: A chemical reaction is a process in which:

options.text: New substances with different properties are formed

questions.explanation_correct: The correct answer is B because in a chemical reaction, the original substances (reactants) are converted into new substances (products) with different properties. This means that new materials are formed during the reaction, not just physical changes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options are not correct. Option A is wrong because in a chemical reaction, new substances are indeed formed. Option C is wrong because chemical reactions involve changes in the molecular structure, not just physical changes. Option D is wrong because something definitely happens during a chemical reaction - new products are created.

questions.question_text: The starting materials in a chemical reaction are called:
questions.explanation_correct: The starting materials in a chemical reaction are called reactants. Reactants are the substances that come together and undergo a chemical change to form new substances, called products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is B) Reactants. Reactants are the starting materials that take part in a chemical reaction and are converted into new substances called products. The other options are incorrect - products are the new substances formed, catalysts are substances that speed up a reaction without being consumed, and elements are the basic building blocks of all matter.

questions.question_text: The substances formed in a chemical reaction are called:
questions.explanation_correct: The substances formed in a chemical reaction are called products. This is because the original substances (called reactants) have been converted into new substances with different properties during the reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The substances that are present at the start of the reaction and take part in the reaction are called reactants. They are not the same as the products, which are the new substances formed after the reaction is complete. Reactants are not the same as elements, which are the basic building blocks of all matter. The products of a reaction are also not mixtures, which are physical combinations of different substances.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is evidence that a chemical reaction has occurred?

options.text: Formation of new substance with different properties

questions.explanation_correct: The formation of a new substance with different properties is the best evidence that a chemical reaction has occurred. This is because a chemical reaction involves the rearrangement of atoms to create new compounds with distinct characteristics, unlike physical changes that only involve changes in shape, size, or position without creating new substances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options (A, B, and D) are not sufficient evidence of a chemical reaction. Changes in shape, size, or position can occur during physical changes as well, without the formation of a new substance. Only the creation of a new material with different properties, such as color, odor, or state, is a clear sign that a chemical reaction has taken place.

questions.question_text: In a word equation, reactants are written on the:
questions.explanation_correct: In a word equation, the reactants (starting substances) are written on the left side, before the arrow. This is because the reaction starts with the reactants and then produces the products on the right side of the arrow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reactants are not written on the right side, top, or bottom of the equation. The correct way to represent a chemical reaction in a word equation is to have the reactants on the left side, separated by a plus sign (+), and the products on the right side, also separated by a plus sign. The arrow in the middle shows that the reactants are being converted into the products.

questions.question_text: In a word equation, products are written on the:
questions.explanation_correct: In a word equation, the products of the chemical reaction are written on the right side, after the arrow. This is because the arrow represents the direction in which the reaction is occurring, and the products are the new substances formed at the end of the reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The products are not written on the left side, top, or bottom of the word equation. The correct way to represent a chemical reaction is to write the reactants on the left side, and the products on the right side, separated by an arrow. This shows the direction in which the reaction is taking place, and the new substances that are formed.

questions.question_text: Which word equation correctly represents burning of magnesium?
questions.explanation_correct: The correct word equation is Magnesium + Oxygen gives Magnesium oxide. This represents a combination reaction where magnesium and oxygen react to form the new substance magnesium oxide.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect options do not correctly represent the burning of magnesium. Option A shows magnesium oxide breaking down, which is the opposite of what happens in the burning reaction. Option C and D incorrectly show oxygen or magnesium as products, when the correct product is magnesium oxide.

questions.question_text: A combination reaction is one in which:

options.text: Two or more substances combine to form one product

questions.explanation_correct: In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single new substance. This is the defining feature of a combination reaction, where the products have different properties compared to the starting reactants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a combination reaction, two or more substances come together to create a new substance. This is different from a decomposition reaction, where a single substance breaks down into two or more simpler substances. Option B correctly describes the key aspect of a combination reaction.

questions.question_text: A decomposition reaction is one in which:

options.text: One substance breaks down into simpler substances

questions.explanation_correct: In a decomposition reaction, a single substance breaks down into two or more simpler substances. This means that one substance on the left side of the reaction arrow is converted into multiple substances on the right side of the arrow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single new substance. This is the opposite of a decomposition reaction, where a single substance breaks down into multiple simpler substances. Options A and D are not correct because they do not describe the defining feature of a decomposition reaction.

questions.question_text: Iron + Oxygen gives Iron oxide. This is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: This is a combination reaction because two different substances (iron and oxygen) are combining to form a new single substance (iron oxide).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reaction between iron and oxygen is not a decomposition reaction because a single substance is not breaking down into two or more simpler substances. It is also not a physical change, as a new chemical compound (iron oxide) is formed. The reaction between iron and oxygen is a combination reaction where the two reactants combine to form a single product.

questions.question_text: Calcium carbonate gives Calcium oxide + Carbon dioxide (on heating). This is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: This is an example of a decomposition reaction because a single substance, calcium carbonate, is breaking down into two simpler substances, calcium oxide and carbon dioxide, when heated.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The question describes a reaction where calcium carbonate is converted into calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. This is not a combination reaction, as it involves the breakdown of a single substance into two products, rather than the combining of two or more substances to form a single product. It is also not a physical change, as the chemical composition of the substances is changing.

questions.question_text: A reaction that releases heat is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A reaction that releases heat is called an exothermic reaction. This is because the products of the reaction have less heat energy than the reactants, so the extra energy is released as heat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An endothermic reaction is a reaction that absorbs heat from the surroundings. This means that the products of the reaction have more heat energy than the reactants. An exothermic reaction is the opposite - it releases heat to the surroundings as the products have less heat energy than the reactants.

questions.question_text: A reaction that absorbs heat is called:
questions.explanation_correct: A reaction that absorbs heat is called an endothermic reaction. This means that the reaction needs to 'take in' or 'absorb' heat energy from the surroundings in order to occur.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An exothermic reaction is the opposite - it is a reaction that releases heat energy. So option A is incorrect. A neutral reaction is one that does not involve any release or absorption of heat, which is not the case here. And a 'fast' reaction just refers to the speed of the reaction, not whether it is endothermic or exothermic, so option D is also not correct.

questions.question_text: Burning of wood is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Burning of wood is an example of an exothermic reaction because it releases heat energy. When wood is burned, the chemical reaction between wood (fuel) and oxygen in the air produces new substances like carbon dioxide and water, and this process gives off a lot of heat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Burning of wood is not an endothermic reaction because endothermic reactions absorb heat energy, not release it. Burning is a chemical reaction that produces new substances and releases a lot of heat, so it is an exothermic reaction. It is also not a physical change, which is just a change in the physical properties of a substance without any new substances being formed.

questions.question_text: Photosynthesis in plants is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Photosynthesis is an endothermic reaction because it absorbs energy (in the form of sunlight) to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Photosynthesis is not an exothermic reaction because it does not release energy. It is also not a physical change, as it involves chemical changes in the plants. While photosynthesis does involve the breakdown of carbon dioxide and water, it is not a decomposition reaction as it creates a new product (glucose) instead of just breaking down the reactants.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is a chemical reaction?
questions.explanation_correct: Rusting of iron is a chemical reaction because it involves the conversion of iron metal into a new substance called iron oxide, which has different properties. This change in the chemical composition of the material is the hallmark of a chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Melting of ice, boiling of water, and breaking of glass are all physical changes, not chemical reactions. In a physical change, the substance's composition remains the same, but its physical properties like shape, size, or state change. Only the rusting of iron involves the creation of a new chemical substance, which makes it a true chemical reaction.

questions.question_text: Cooking of food is a chemical reaction because:

options.text: New substances with new taste and smell are formed

questions.explanation_correct: Cooking food is a chemical reaction because new substances with different tastes and smells are formed. This happens as the heat causes the chemical bonds in the food to break and rearrange, creating new molecules with new properties.
questions.explanation_incorrect: While cooking makes the food hot and soft, and can sometimes change its color, these are just physical changes. The key feature of a chemical reaction is the formation of completely new substances, which is what happens during cooking as the food's chemical composition is altered.

questions.question_text: Electrolysis of water produces hydrogen and oxygen. This is an example of:
questions.explanation_correct: Electrolysis of water involves the breaking down of water (H2O) into its two simpler elements, hydrogen (H2) and oxygen (O2). This is an example of a decomposition reaction, where a single compound is split into two or more substances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The electrolysis of water is not a combination reaction, as it does not involve two or more substances combining to form a single product. It is also not a physical change, as the chemical composition of water is changed during the process. Rather, it is a decomposition reaction where water is broken down into its constituent elements, hydrogen and oxygen.

questions.question_text: Respiration in living organisms is:
questions.explanation_correct: Respiration in living organisms is an exothermic reaction, which means it releases heat energy. During respiration, the body breaks down food substances like glucose to produce energy, and this process releases heat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Respiration is not an endothermic reaction, which means it does not absorb heat energy. Respiration also does not involve a physical change, where the substance remains the same but its physical properties change. Respiration is a chemical reaction where the reactants (food substances) are converted into different products (energy, carbon dioxide, water) with new properties.

questions.question_text: Which type of reaction represents: Hydrogen + Chlorine gives Hydrogen chloride?
questions.explanation_correct: The reaction between hydrogen and chlorine to form hydrogen chloride is a combination reaction. In a combination reaction, two or more reactants combine to form a single product, which is the correct description of this reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The given reaction does not represent a decomposition reaction, as a single substance is not breaking down into two or more simpler substances. It also does not represent a neutralization reaction, which involves an acid and a base, or a physical change, which does not involve the formation of new substances. The correct type of reaction is a combination reaction, where two elements (hydrogen and chlorine) combine to form a single compound (hydrogen chloride).

questions.question_text: Digestion of food is:
questions.explanation_correct: Digestion of food is a chemical reaction because it involves breaking down the complex molecules in food into simpler substances that the body can use. This process changes the chemical properties of the food, which is the definition of a chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Digestion of food is not a physical change, as it does not just involve a change in the physical properties of the food, like its shape or state. It is also not a reversible change, as the food cannot be easily converted back to its original form after being digested. Digestion is a chemical reaction where the food is broken down into simpler substances that the body can use.

questions.question_text: Carbon + Oxygen gives Carbon dioxide. In this word equation, the reactants are:
questions.explanation_correct: The reactants in the given word equation are carbon and oxygen. This is because the equation shows that carbon and oxygen combine to form carbon dioxide, so carbon and oxygen are the starting substances that react to produce the product.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is that the reactants are carbon and oxygen. The word equation shows that carbon and oxygen are the two substances that react together to form carbon dioxide. Option A is incorrect because carbon dioxide is the product, not a reactant. Options C and D are also incorrect because the equation involves both carbon and oxygen as the reactants.

questions.question_text: In an exothermic reaction, the surroundings:
questions.explanation_correct: In an exothermic reaction, the surroundings become warmer because the reaction releases heat energy to the environment. This heat warms up the area around the reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: An exothermic reaction releases heat energy, so the surroundings become warmer, not cooler. The reaction does not cause the surroundings to stay the same or disappear - the heat released from the reaction is what warms up the area around it.

questions.question_text: In an endothermic reaction, the surroundings:
questions.explanation_correct: In an endothermic reaction, the surroundings become cooler because the reaction absorbs heat from the environment to proceed. This means the surroundings lose heat and get cooler.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A is incorrect because in an endothermic reaction, the surroundings become cooler, not warmer. Option C is incorrect because the surroundings do not stay the same - they actually become cooler. Option D is incorrect because the surroundings do not disappear, they just lose some heat energy to the reaction.

questions.question_text: Heating of lead nitrate produces lead oxide, nitrogen dioxide, and oxygen. This is:
questions.explanation_correct: This is a decomposition reaction because a single substance (lead nitrate) is breaking down into multiple simpler substances (lead oxide, nitrogen dioxide, and oxygen).
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is not a combination reaction because the starting substance (lead nitrate) is not combining with another substance to form a single new product. It is also not a physical change, as the composition of the substances is changing. And it is not a neutralization reaction, as there is no acid-base reaction happening.

questions.question_text: Which of the following is NOT a chemical reaction?
questions.explanation_correct: Dissolving sugar in water is not a chemical reaction. When you mix sugar and water, the sugar dissolves but its chemical structure does not change. This is a physical change, not a chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The other options (burning a candle, rusting of iron, and cooking an egg) are all examples of chemical reactions. In these cases, the substances undergo a chemical change and new substances are formed with different properties. For example, when you burn a candle, the wax and oxygen in the air combine to form carbon dioxide and water, which are new substances.

questions.question_text: What does the arrow in a word equation represent?
questions.explanation_correct: The arrow in a word equation represents 'gives' or 'produces'. It shows that the substances on the left side (reactants) are converted into the new substances on the right side (products) in a chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The arrow does not represent addition, subtraction, or equality. It specifically indicates that the reactants on the left side are transformed into the new products on the right side. The arrow shows the direction of the chemical change, not a mathematical operation.

questions.question_text: Burning of natural gas for cooking is:
questions.explanation_correct: Burning of natural gas is an exothermic and chemical reaction. This is because during the burning process, the natural gas (a chemical substance) reacts with oxygen in the air to produce new substances like carbon dioxide and water, releasing heat in the process. This change in the chemical composition of the substances is a clear indication of a chemical reaction, not a physical one.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The burning of natural gas is not an endothermic reaction, as it releases heat rather than absorbing it. It is also not a purely physical process, as the chemical composition of the substances changes during the reaction. The correct answer is that burning of natural gas is an exothermic and chemical reaction, where the natural gas reacts with oxygen to form new substances like carbon dioxide and water, while releasing heat.

questions.question_text: Sodium + Chlorine gives Sodium chloride. This is:
questions.explanation_correct: This is a combination reaction because two or more substances (sodium and chlorine) are combining to form a single new substance (sodium chloride).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The question states that sodium and chlorine are forming sodium chloride, which is a single new substance. This means it is not a decomposition reaction where a single substance breaks down into two or more simpler substances. It is also not a physical change, as a chemical reaction has occurred to create a new material with different properties.

questions.question_text: Which everyday process involves chemical reactions?
questions.explanation_correct: Digestion of food involves chemical reactions where the complex molecules in food are broken down into simpler ones that can be absorbed by the body. This is an everyday process that happens in our body to provide energy and nutrients.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Switching on a light, melting of ice cream, and folding of paper do not involve chemical reactions. These are physical changes where the substances do not change their composition. Chemical reactions only happen when the chemical structure of substances is altered to form new substances with different properties.

questions.question_text: In a chemical reaction, new substances are formed.
questions.explanation_correct: In a chemical reaction, new substances are formed with different properties than the original substances (the reactants). This is the defining feature of a chemical reaction - the creation of new materials through the rearrangement of atoms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A chemical reaction is not just a physical change, where the original substances remain the same. Instead, the atoms rearrange to form completely new substances with different chemical properties. If no new substances were formed, it would be a physical change like melting ice, not a chemical reaction.

questions.question_text: Reactants are the substances formed after a chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is false. Reactants are the substances that are present before the chemical reaction takes place. The substances formed after the reaction are called the products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The reactants are the starting substances that are used in the chemical reaction. They are not the substances that are formed after the reaction. The products are the new substances that are created during the chemical reaction.

questions.question_text: In a word equation, reactants are written on the left side of the arrow.
questions.explanation_correct: In a word equation, the reactants are always written on the left side of the arrow, before the reaction happens. This is because the arrow represents the chemical reaction, where the reactants are converted into the products on the right side of the arrow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a word equation, the products are not written on the left side of the arrow. The reactants, which are the starting substances, are always written on the left side before the reaction takes place. The products, which are the new substances formed after the reaction, are written on the right side of the arrow.

questions.question_text: In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form one product.
questions.explanation_correct: In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single new product. This is the defining feature of a combination reaction, so the statement is true.
questions.explanation_incorrect: In a combination reaction, two or more substances come together to form a single new product. This is different from a decomposition reaction, where a single substance breaks down into two or more simpler substances. So the statement 'In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form one product' is correct.

questions.question_text: In a decomposition reaction, a single substance breaks down into simpler substances.
questions.explanation_correct: The statement is true because in a decomposition reaction, a single compound breaks down into two or more simpler substances. This is the defining feature of a decomposition reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The statement is false because in a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single new substance. In a decomposition reaction, a single substance actually breaks down into two or more simpler substances, not the other way around.

questions.question_text: Exothermic reactions release heat.
questions.explanation_correct: Exothermic reactions release heat because the products of the reaction have less energy than the reactants. This extra energy is released as heat, which warms up the surroundings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Endothermic reactions absorb heat from the surroundings, while exothermic reactions release heat to the surroundings. In an exothermic reaction, the products have less energy than the reactants, so the extra energy is released as heat. This means that exothermic reactions make the surroundings warmer.

questions.question_text: Burning of fuels is an endothermic reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: Burning of fuels is an exothermic reaction, not an endothermic reaction. Exothermic reactions release heat, while endothermic reactions absorb heat. When fuels like wood or gas burn, they release a lot of heat, making it an exothermic process.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The burning of fuels is not an endothermic reaction. Endothermic reactions absorb heat from the surroundings, but in the case of burning fuels, a lot of heat is released into the surroundings. This makes it an exothermic reaction, where the products have less energy compared to the reactants.

questions.question_text: Photosynthesis is an endothermic reaction because it absorbs energy from sunlight.
questions.explanation_correct: Photosynthesis is an endothermic reaction because it absorbs energy from sunlight. During photosynthesis, plants use the energy from sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose, a process that requires energy input.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Photosynthesis is not an exothermic reaction. Exothermic reactions release energy, while photosynthesis absorbs energy from sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose. This makes photosynthesis an endothermic reaction, where the reactants (carbon dioxide and water) have more energy than the products (glucose and oxygen).

questions.question_text: Rusting of iron is a chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: Rusting of iron is a chemical reaction because it involves the conversion of iron metal into a new substance (iron oxide) with different properties. During rusting, iron reacts with oxygen in the air to form a reddish-brown substance called rust, which has different chemical and physical properties compared to pure iron.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Rusting of iron is not a physical reaction. In a physical reaction, the substance's composition does not change, only its physical properties like shape, size, or state. However, in rusting, the iron metal undergoes a chemical change and is converted into a new compound (iron oxide) with different chemical properties. Therefore, rusting is a chemical reaction and not a physical reaction.

questions.question_text: The electrolysis of water is a combination reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: The electrolysis of water is a decomposition reaction, not a combination reaction. In this process, water (H2O) is broken down into two simpler substances - hydrogen gas (H2) and oxygen gas (O2). This is the opposite of a combination reaction, where two or more substances come together to form a single new product.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The electrolysis of water is not a combination reaction. In a combination reaction, two or more substances combine to form a single new product. However, in the electrolysis of water, a single substance (water) is broken down into two simpler substances (hydrogen and oxygen). This is a decomposition reaction, where a single substance is split into two or more new substances.

questions.question_text: A chemical reaction is a process in which new _______ are formed.
questions.explanation_correct: A chemical reaction is a process where new substances are formed, with different properties than the original substances. This is because the atoms rearrange to create new chemical compounds during the reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'substances'. In a chemical reaction, new substances are formed as the original reactants are converted into different products. The word 'substances' is the exact format required to fill in the blank. The reaction does not just involve a change in properties, but the creation of entirely new chemical compounds.

questions.question_text: The starting materials in a chemical reaction are called _______.
questions.explanation_correct: The starting materials in a chemical reaction are called reactants because they react with each other to form new substances, called products. Reactants are the substances that undergo a chemical change during the reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The wrong answer would be 'products'. Products are the new substances formed at the end of a chemical reaction, not the starting materials. The correct term for the starting materials in a chemical reaction is 'reactants', which is the exact answer format expected.

questions.question_text: The substances formed in a chemical reaction are called _______.
questions.explanation_correct: The substances formed in a chemical reaction are called products because they are the new substances that result from the reaction between the original reactants. The reactants are the starting materials that undergo changes to form the new products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The substances formed in a chemical reaction are called 'products', not 'reactants'. Reactants are the starting materials that are used up in the chemical reaction to form the new products. The products have different properties compared to the original reactants, which is what defines a chemical reaction.

questions.question_text: A reaction in which two or more substances combine to form one product is called a _______ reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: A combination reaction is when two or more substances come together to form a single new substance. This is the correct answer because the question asks about a reaction where multiple reactants combine to produce one product, which is the definition of a combination reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect answer would be a decomposition reaction. In a decomposition reaction, a single substance breaks down into two or more simpler substances. However, the question asks about a reaction where two or more substances combine to form one product, which is the definition of a combination reaction.

questions.question_text: A reaction in which a single substance breaks down into simpler substances is called a _______ reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: A decomposition reaction is a type of chemical reaction where a single substance breaks down into two or more simpler substances. This matches the description given in the question, so 'decomposition' is the correct answer.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The accepted answer format is 'decomposition'. This is because a decomposition reaction involves a single substance breaking down into two or more simpler substances, which is the opposite of a combination reaction where two or more substances come together to form a single product.

questions.question_text: A reaction that releases heat is called an _______ reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: A reaction that releases heat is called an exothermic reaction. This is because the energy released during the reaction is in the form of heat, which warms up the surroundings.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The answer 'exothermic' is correct. A reaction that releases heat is called an exothermic reaction. This means that the energy is released from the reaction, warming up the surroundings. Reactions that absorb heat are called endothermic reactions.

questions.question_text: A reaction that absorbs heat is called an _______ reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: An endothermic reaction is a chemical reaction that absorbs heat energy from the surroundings to occur. This means that the products of the reaction have more energy than the reactants, so the reaction needs to take in heat from the environment.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'endothermic'. Endothermic reactions are those that absorb heat energy, unlike exothermic reactions which release heat. So an endothermic reaction is the type of reaction that absorbs heat from the surroundings to occur. The word 'endothermic' means 'inside heat', indicating that the reaction takes in heat.

questions.question_text: Burning of wood is an example of an _______ reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: Burning of wood is an exothermic reaction because it releases heat energy. When wood burns, it reacts with oxygen in the air to produce new substances like carbon dioxide and water, and this process gives off heat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Burning of wood is not an endothermic reaction. Endothermic reactions absorb heat energy, but burning wood actually releases a lot of heat. The correct answer is 'exothermic', which means the reaction gives off heat rather than taking it in.

questions.question_text: _______ is an example of an endothermic reaction in plants.
questions.explanation_correct: Photosynthesis is an endothermic reaction in plants because it absorbs energy from sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen. This process requires energy, so it is classified as an endothermic reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'Photosynthesis'. Photosynthesis is an endothermic reaction because it requires energy from sunlight to occur. During photosynthesis, plants use the energy from sunlight to convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose and oxygen. This process absorbs energy, so it is considered an endothermic reaction. The other options are not examples of endothermic reactions in plants.

questions.question_text: In a word equation, the arrow represents '_______' or 'produces'.
questions.explanation_correct: The arrow in a word equation represents the transformation or conversion of the reactants into the products. It shows that the substances on the left side are 'giving' or 'producing' the substances on the right side, so the correct word to use is 'gives'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The arrow in a word equation does not represent 'produces' or 'creates' the products. Instead, it shows that the reactants on the left side are 'giving' or 'converting' into the products on the right side. The correct word to use in the blank is 'gives', which represents this transformation process.

questions.question_text: The chemical change that occurs when iron reacts with oxygen and water is called _______.
questions.explanation_correct: The chemical change that occurs when iron reacts with oxygen and water is called rusting. Rusting is a chemical reaction where iron combines with oxygen and water to form a reddish-brown compound called iron oxide, which is the correct answer 'rusting'.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The chemical change that occurs when iron reacts with oxygen and water is not called oxidation or corrosion, but rather the specific term 'rusting'. Rusting is the accepted answer format, which refers to the process where iron combines with oxygen and water to form a new substance called iron oxide, giving the reddish-brown color we commonly see on old iron objects.

questions.question_text: When calcium carbonate is heated, it breaks down into calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. This is a _______ reaction.
questions.explanation_correct: This is a decomposition reaction because the single substance calcium carbonate breaks down into two simpler substances, calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. Decomposition reactions involve one substance splitting into two or more new substances.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The correct answer is 'decomposition'. In this reaction, the single substance calcium carbonate is breaking down into two new substances, calcium oxide and carbon dioxide. Decomposition reactions involve a single substance splitting into two or more simpler substances. This is not a combination reaction, where two or more substances combine to form a single new substance.

questions.question_text: Arrange the parts of a word equation: Products, Arrow, Reactants
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Reactants, Arrow, Products because in a chemical reaction, the starting substances (reactants) are written on the left side, followed by an arrow, and then the resulting new substances (products) are written on the right side. This order clearly shows how the reactants are converted into the products through the chemical reaction.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be Products, Arrow, Reactants. This is not correct because in a chemical reaction, we first have the starting substances (reactants) that undergo a change, which is represented by the arrow, and then the new substances (products) are formed. The order should always be reactants first, followed by the arrow, and then the products.

questions.question_text: Arrange steps in a combination reaction: Products formed, Reactants combine, New bonds form
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is Reactants combine, New bonds form, Products formed because in a combination reaction, the reactants (starting substances) first come together, then new chemical bonds are formed between the atoms, and this leads to the formation of the final products (new substances).
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order is Products formed, Reactants combine, New bonds form. This is not correct because in a chemical reaction, the reactants first come together, then new bonds are formed between the atoms, which leads to the formation of the final products. The steps cannot be reversed as the products are formed as a result of the reactants combining and new bonds forming.

questions.question_text: Arrange steps in a decomposition reaction: Single compound heated, Bonds break, Simpler products formed
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is 'Single compound heated, Bonds break, Simpler products formed' because in a decomposition reaction, a single compound is first heated. This heat energy causes the chemical bonds in the compound to break, which then leads to the formation of two or more simpler products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order is 'Simpler products formed, Single compound heated, Bonds break'. This is not the correct sequence because the bonds in the compound must first break due to the heat energy, which then allows the formation of simpler products. The heating of the single compound is the first step that initiates the decomposition reaction.

questions.question_text: Arrange from releasing most heat to absorbing heat: Burning fuel, Photosynthesis, Dissolving ammonium chloride
questions.explanation_correct: Burning fuel releases the most heat, as it is an exothermic reaction. Photosynthesis is an endothermic reaction, where plants absorb heat from sunlight. Dissolving ammonium chloride in water is also an endothermic reaction, which absorbs heat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The order from releasing most heat to absorbing heat is: Burning fuel, Dissolving ammonium chloride, Photosynthesis. Burning fuel releases a lot of heat, making it an exothermic reaction. Dissolving ammonium chloride in water is also an endothermic reaction, where some heat is absorbed. However, photosynthesis is the process where plants absorb sunlight and use it to make their own food, which is the most endothermic of the three reactions.

questions.question_text: Arrange the stages of cooking food: Heat applied, Food changes properties, New substances formed, Chemical reaction occurs
questions.explanation_correct: The correct order is: Heat applied, Chemical reaction occurs, New substances formed, Food changes properties. This is because when heat is applied to food, it triggers a chemical reaction that causes the food to change its properties and form new substances, which results in the final cooked product.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The incorrect order would be: New substances formed, Heat applied, Chemical reaction occurs, Food changes properties. This is wrong because the chemical reaction must happen first, before new substances are formed and the food changes its properties. The heat must be applied to start the chemical reaction, which then leads to the formation of new substances and the changed properties of the food.
